intro: Reidia beddomei, commonly known as the Beddome's reidia, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, aromatic scent. Reidia beddomei is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
